name: Head Tilts
how_to_perform:
1. Start by sitting or standing with good posture and looking straight ahead.

2. Tilt your head to one side, keeping your chin at a 45-degree angle from your body. You should feel the stretch on the opposite side of your neck.

3. Hold the tilt for a brief moment (about 5-10 seconds).

4. Return your head to its original position and repeat on the other side by tilting it to the opposite direction.

5. Continue alternating sides, holding each tilt for the same duration, to maintain optimal stretching benefits.
short_summary: Head tilts are a simple exercise that targets the neck muscles, designed to stretch and relieve tension in this area.
